intro: Trevirana discolor, commonly known as the variable violet, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive purple to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Trevirana discolor is notable for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its ornamental value in gardens.
